channel.title: [317]Fixing Lost Valentinos Skillcape GFX facing south Problem![317]
channel.description:
[size=24pt][center]Comment please!!!!![/center][/size] Hello Moparscapians :D
I have created a method to have the GFX of the skillcapes to face ANY direction and STILL work!! you must have followed Lost Valentino's tutorial on how to add the emotes.
instead of using the stillGFX crap, whoch basically keeps the GFX in one direction (fail...)
[code=java] public void gfx0(int gfx){ mask100var1 = gfx; mask100var2 = 65536; mask100update = true; updateRequired = true; }
[/code] Now, DO NOT REPLACE ANY GFX METHODS!!!!!!!!!!! just add it under one of them. Then, in client.java search for: [code=java]stillgfx(626, absX, absY);[/code] or something like that and then replace ALL of the stillgfx methods used for the skillcapes, like this: [code=java]gfx0(626);[/code]
Now, you think we are done, but no! Valentinos GFX's delays were different than the emote, because the gfx is slower than the emote. so, now the gfx delays are 3, and the emote is 4. which means, the gfx WILL AND SHALL go faster then the emote. the code actually CORRECTS the speed of the gfx. so, the emote and gfx have the same delays, and not different from the other! now, in your class20.java, search for the Herblore GFX, (4970)
then, you see all the 3's? replace them with 4 E.G: [code=java];{3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3};[/code]
Why did we do this? Because the gfx does not have the same delays as the emote anymore. the stillgfx slowed the gfx down, but then after we added my method, the gfx goes twice as fast.
You're done adding the new GFX method!! [size=24pt]I REPEAT, do NOT replave any other GFX Methods! just add my method under your other GFX methods!!![/size]
hope this helps!!

item.title: [317]Fixing Lost Valentinos Skillcape GFX facing south Problem![317]
item.dc:creator: @Ironclad722 Ironclad722
item.description:
@Ironclad722 wrote:

[quote=“s w 3 3 t1, post:15, topic:354836”]hey, i need some help, i don’t know where to put this:
public void gfx0(int gfx){
mask100var1 = gfx;
mask100var2 = 65536;
mask100update = true;
updateRequired = true;
}
thanks.[/quote]
in client.java under player implements(){

[quote=“Kieron532, post:14, topic:354836”]when i compile i get 24 errors of this sort of thing:

client.java:263: gfx0<int> in the client cannot be applied to <int,int,int> gfx0<609, absy, absx>; [/quote]

instead of

gfx0(609, absy, absx);

replace with:

gfx0(609);

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Fixing Lost Valentinos Skillcape GFX facing south Problem![317]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“WaleedScape, post:5, topic:354836”]No, valentino used the same method stillgfx of the weapons for the sillcapes, and that method only worked for weapons and such. but this is a totally Hand-written method by me, and you dont need to edit delays unless you have a bluurr
:X

UPDATE: just noticed you DONT have to edit delays!!!
P.S. some people might have to if the delays are different than the other
wewt! my code is 100%!!!
finally, Valentino isnt the only one with 100% skillcape emotes on a bluurrss…[/quote]
Its really not as hard as people keep making it out to be. Ive had skillcape emotes since about 1 day after i figured out where to dump emote-files in the 508 client.

Read full topic

item.description:
@WaleedScape wrote:

No, valentino used the same method stillgfx of the weapons for the sillcapes, and that method only worked for weapons and such. but this is a totally Hand-written method by me, and you dont need to edit delays unless you have a bluurr
:X

UPDATE: just noticed you DONT have to edit delays!!!
P.S. some people might have to if the delays are different than the other
wewt! my code is 100%!!!
finally, Valentino isnt the only one with 100% skillcape emotes on a bluurrss…

item.title: [317]Fixing Lost Valentinos Skillcape GFX facing south Problem![317]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“WaleedScape, post:3, topic:354836”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=451405.msg3308907#msg3308907 date=1281839733]
The graphics should not need to be fixed if you did this correctly. Also, this is server-sided, lets keep it in the correct section?
[/quote]
you’re mistaken. you must do the delay editing in class20 IF you have a bluurrs
cant you see you’re supposed to edit the delays in class20.java client sided?[/quote]
No shit, but you shouldn’t need to add delays to the emote if you did it correctly is all im saying. Typically the method servers use for the special gfx for weapons, IS the method you would use for this this?

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Fixing Lost Valentinos Skillcape GFX facing south Problem![317]
item.dc:creator: @WaleedScape WaleedScape
item.description:
@WaleedScape wrote:

[size=24pt][center]Comment please!!![/center][/size]
Hello Moparscapians

I have created a method to have the GFX of the skillcapes to face ANY direction and STILL work!!
you must have followed Lost Valentino’s tutorial on how to add the emotes.

instead of using the stillGFX crap, whoch basically keeps the GFX in one direction
(fail…)

[code=java]
public void gfx0(int gfx){
mask100var1 = gfx;
mask100var2 = 65536;
mask100update = true;
updateRequired = true;
}

	[/code]

Now, DO NOT REPLACE ANY GFX METHODS!!!
just add it under one of them.
Then, in client.java search for:

stillgfx(626, absX, absY);

or something like that and then replace ALL of the stillgfx methods used for the skillcapes, like this:

gfx0(626);

Now, you think we are done, but no! Valentinos GFX’s delays were different than the emote, because the gfx is slower than the emote. so, now the gfx delays are 3, and the emote is 4. which means, the gfx WILL AND SHALL go faster then the emote. the code actually CORRECTS the speed of the gfx. so, the emote and gfx have the same delays, and not different from the other!
now, in your class20.java, search for the Herblore GFX, (4970)

then, you see all the 3’s?
replace them with 4
E.G:

;{3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3};

Why did we do this? Because the gfx does not have the same delays as the emote anymore. the stillgfx slowed the gfx down, but then after we added my method, the gfx goes twice as fast.

You’re done adding the new GFX method!!
[size=24pt]I REPEAT, do NOT replave any other GFX Methods! just add my method under your other GFX methods!!![/size]

hope this helps!!

Read full topic
